author: Robert Kirr
comment: like it! responsive. colorful. no errors.   and what I like most: it's the first dialer that let me search in contacts (using speech). cool.   Alexander, good job!     May I suggest you if possible to enhance:  I start the call from watch. My bluetooth hands-free is in my ear. On watch, the bluetooth sign is on the blue button bottom right. I start to push the button. bluetooth > phone speaker > phone earpiece > phone speaker > phone earpiece > .... so I do not have the possibility to came back on hands-free device.  also the status of the used device on the phone display  does not change. the phone will continue to show bluetooth is used, even I'm already on speaker or earpiece.  samsung s6 and LG watch R both on 5.1.1.  10x!  robert

reply.author: Alexander Slobodchikov
reply.content:
Robert thank you for the purchase and for the great reply!
1. I will try to reproduce this bug and fix it!
2. "the phone will continue to show bluetooth is used, even I'm already on speaker or earpiece" - unfortunately it seems not fixable because the phone app does not update buttons state when other app switches bluetooth/speaker.

author: Stewart Wood
comment: I really wanted to like this app. But.   It simply doesn't work on my Moto 360. It's either frozen or dials a completely random number.   I don't like to ask for a refund as you seem a really decent guy, but unfortunately it just doesn't work - and I've tried all the troubleshooting steps you've suggested in these feedback responses.

author: Brandon Allbery
comment: Nice app, better than the other watch dialers I tried. Two questions though: - is there a way for it to provide a keypad *during* a call? (I have a feeling the answer is "no" due to API limitations.) - on a long call, the screen eventually "times out". Is there a control for how long this takes?

reply.author: Alexander Slobodchikov
reply.content: Thanks Brandon! About keypad - yes you are right, it's not possible to send DTFM tones during a call in Android unfortunately. On your second question - hmm... I've added it to my stack of tasks, hope I will find a bit of time to solve it!

author: Pramod
comment: After installing this app, it is working fine for outgoing calls but it is not allowing to take incoming calls. I am using Nexus 6 and moto 360 2nd gen. Also during incoming calls my phone ringtone is not playing, as if it is in silent mode.
title: Messed up with incoming calls

author: Chris Twiner
comment: I wanted the ability to mute my calls through my watch as I'm often on calls whilst moving and hate having repeatedly to take the phone out to control the mute.  This app does exactly that even if you started the call on the phone. The bad news is that the app dissappears shortly after starting it, if I've started it by hand it should stay open until I swipe it closed. Fix that and it's a clear 4, making the mute button the biggest on the screen an easy 5.(FYI I have not used any other functions of the app)
title: I'd give 4 but it doesn't stay open

author: Fred Pocai
comment: This app is honestly one of the reasons I started looking at Smartwatches in the first place. When I found out I can mute/unmute a call in-progress from my wrist without having to take my phone out of my pocket, unlock the screen, and change windows to get back to the phone app, I knew that I needed to have it.  I spend a lot of time on conference calls so being able to quickly and easily mute/unmute my mic is vital.  What's also real nice is it doesn't seem to matter if I start or answer the call from the phone, the app, or "OK Google".    The only problem, and that keeps me from giving a 5th star, is that I can't for the life of me figure out how to get back to the call-in-progress screen if I leave the app on my watch.  I was just in a call a few minutes ago, received some notifications from other apps during the call, and tried to return back to Watch Phone, but couldn't control the ongoing call anymore.  This functionality, if it exists, doesn't seem to be very intuitive.

author: Kwasi Sasu Domfeh
comment: I really like this app. The only downside is the contact which is not accessed by alphabet . I don't have to scroll downwards all the way to access contact starting with the letter Z.
title: Nice wear app. Contact shd be accessed by alphabet as on phone.

author: Behzad Live
comment: After installing this app , `always on` not working and this app doing my brightness for level 1. Pls fix it. My screen in watch is black after installing. Im unistall and work fine again. Lg g watch
title: Always on not working

author: Tony D.
comment: I like it, but it gives no way to answer incoming calls. Can this be remedied? Also, there's no persistent call notification after placing a call from the dialer, so I cannot mute, etc, the call after it is placed. If this cannot be remedied, may I have a refund, please? Huawei Watch.
title: Half functionality

author: Matt Longman
comment: Without incoming call capabilities, it only does the job half the time. The mute button should be bigger and easier to press.

comment: After recent update application stop working.  It runs but could not retrieve contacts or favorites.

comment: I can now dial calls from my moto 360 sport and view my contact list

reply.content: Shabier, please try to reinstall the app. Where are no significant changes in the last version of the app which could cause any problem. I belive it is a random temporary glitch.

comment: Great app !!!!

author: Erik Grijalva
comment: I'm happy with dialer and all options so far.  However one annoying quirk i have is while in a call my moto 360 has that little black cutoff at the bottom so part of the screen is cut off making it hard to access in call buttons at the bottom of the app. Any fix?

reply.author: Alexander Slobodchikov
reply.content: Erik, thanks for the reply! Of course I will fix it. All my impression about my app on Moto 360 was based on these photos http://goo.gl/UckCCI because I haven't Moto 360. So I desided mistakenly what all the buttons are at the screen at least. You can join my beta-testing community here: https://goo.gl/inZy7C and I could send you the pre-release.

title: Great dialer

author: Brian Lim
comment: Been looking for an app like this that can control my calls on my watch, after picking it up. It's a feature that Pebble has but Android wear has been lacking.

reply.author: Alexander Slobodchikov
reply.content: Thanks, Brian! Yes, after the Android Wear 5.1.1 update rollout this is the last killer-feature in this app:)

title: Great app

author: Randy Harrold
comment: Doesn't show up on my asus zenwatch

reply.author: Alexander Slobodchikov
reply.content: Hello Randy! How much time did you wait after the installation on the smartphone? Sometimes it takes really long period of time to transfer the app through Bluetooth, 5 minutes or even more.

author: Alex Tiong
comment: The reason I am giving a four star now is because all my contact in my phone are not sync to the watch. The contact is empty at my watch side, making it just a dialer app.

reply.author: Alexander Slobodchikov
reply.content:
Hello Alex! It maybe a bug or the app needs more time to transfer contacts data via Bluetooth. What do you see in the contacts list?
Also you can try to start the app on your phone and after what look to the contacts list again.

title: Good apps but perhaps a bug that only I encounter?

reply.author: Alexander Slobodchikov

Hello dear Ismaldo! Thank you for purchase and for good reply!
I consider opportunity to make dialing while in a call, but currently Android does not allow send DTMF tones to the channel from third party apps. One chance is to implement some kind of a hack with root but it is dangerous.

title: Call history

author: Seph Condor
comment: I've tried a few of these apps, and this is by some way my favourite! Nice big icons and buttons which are very helpful when you're walking, and it just looks cool! I need to add it as a button on my custom face and I'll be good to go! The same price as a lottery ticket and it's a guaranteed win!

reply.author: Alexander Slobodchikov
reply.content: Thank you for purchase and for great reply!:)

title: That's a 'yes' from me!

author: G. Lamar Wilkie
comment: Okay, I bought Watch Phone. And I have to say: it's probably the best $1.99 I've spent in a LONG time.  I have a Moto 360 and a rooted Note 4. All I have to do is say to my watch, "Okay Google... start Watch Phone" and it opens the app on the watch. I can initiate calls, look at my call log, all contacts and favorites. It even supports multiple numbers per contact: this app does it all! Since I have a Bluetooth headset, I can now make calls to anyone without ever reaching for my phone. That saves me a lot of screen-on time, which extends the phone's battery life. A true WIN all the way around!  WELL DONE to the Developer! I was happy to send in a couple of bucks for such a phenomenal piece of work.

reply.author: Alexander Slobodchikov
reply.content: Many thanks! When my customers are happy I'm getting hapier too!:)

title: What a WONDERFUL convenience! Stellar app!

author: Stephen Hensley
comment: Would you be so kind as to put up some instructions on how to use it? It's all just symbols right now. I'd especially like to know how to do things with it by voice? Thanks.

reply.author: Alexander Slobodchikov
reply.content:
Thanks for purchase and for the reply! Usage is simple: the yellow button opens favorites list, the green - history, the blue button - keypad for direct dialing, the red button - the whole contacts list. All the lists are synchronized with your smartphone.
You can start the app with voice: "Ok Google", "Start watch phone".

title: This is just what we needed.
